metadata.scenario: Customer service interaction about a delayed package

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm trying to track a package. The tracking information says it was supposed to be delivered yesterday, but I haven't received it. My order number is 12345.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! Thanks for contacting us. I can definitely look into that for you. Please give me a moment to access the details for order number 12345... Okay, I see the package. It appears there was a delay due to a logistical issue. It's currently in transit and is expected to be delivered by end of day tomorrow.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: A logistical issue? What does that even mean? And why wasn't I notified about this? I needed this package for a presentation, and now I'm going to be late!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration, and I sincerely apologize for the lack of notification. The specific nature of the logistical issue isn't detailed in the system, but it often involves things like unexpected high volumes at the sorting facility or unforeseen weather conditions. Unfortunately, the automated system doesn't always flag these delays for immediate customer notifications. Let me see if I can provide any additional details. One moment...

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I guess. Well, what are the chances of actually getting it tomorrow? And can I at least get some sort of compensation for this delay? I did pay for expedited shipping.
